sentences.english: Eagleburger says the U. S. can try to persuade the North Koreans to come back to the negotiating table.
sentences.chinese: 伊格爾伯格說，美國有能力試圖說服北韓重返談判桌。

sentences.english: He is the ideal player for Juve to sign for their return to Serie A.
sentences.chinese: 他是尤文重返甲級聯賽後值得簽下的理想球員。

sentences.english: This allows for the re-entry of the database connection details.
sentences.chinese: 這會重返數據庫連接細節。

sentences.english: I'm still fighting to get fit again but I'm not far away from hopefully being involved in the England set-up again.
sentences.chinese: 我依舊在對抗傷病，但我有信心重返國家隊。

sentences.english: He did not return to the Empire until four years after Palpatine's defeat.
sentences.chinese: 直到帕爾帕廷殞命四年後，他才重返帝國。

sentences.english: And Italy is not alone in its return to coal.
sentences.chinese: 然而，不僅僅是意大利重返用煤發電。

sentences.english: We don't want him back on the court because no one likes a show-off.
sentences.chinese: 我們不想讓他重返球場，因爲沒人喜歡賣弄。

sentences.english: And the surgery they are waiting for is to restore their virginity.
sentences.chinese: 而她們等待的外科手術將使其“重返處女之身”。

sentences.english: The third crew member, Jing Haipeng, monitored the ship from inside the re-entry module.
sentences.chinese: 宇航員第三個成員景海鵬在飛船內部監控重返飛船。

sentences.english: Asked when Steve Jobs would return, Cook spoke carefully.
sentences.chinese: 當被問到喬布斯何時能重返工作崗位，庫克出言謹慎。

sentences.english: Eels are relentless in their effort to return to their oceanic womb.
sentences.chinese: 鰻魚重返大海子宮的努力百折不撓。

sentences.english: In 2013, Barton felt the itch to get back to work.
sentences.chinese: 到了2013年，他又覺得手癢，想重返工作崗位。

sentences.english: It was only six months later that, restless, she jumped back into the swimming pool.
sentences.chinese: 手術後僅半年，耐不住寂寞的杜託伊特便重返泳池。

sentences.english: Small jia she borrow wood, injured advice he should return to the path from the rivers lake.
sentences.chinese: 小嘉便借木榮受傷之事，勸告他應重返正道退出江湖。

sentences.english: Ginsburg was in court Monday, 18 days after her surgery.
sentences.chinese: 金絲伯格術於週一，即術後第十八天，重返法院。

definition: separated in time (usu. followed by a quantity of time)
to leave the mountain (of a hermit)/to come out of obscurity to a government job/to take a leading position
to leave home/to go off/to run away
lit. to return in a swirl of dust (idiom)/fig. to regroup and come back even stronger/to make a comeback
to stand firmly/to gain a foothold/to establish oneself
